class GaussianIntegralExample(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Display the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} e^{-x^2} \,dx")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for switching to polar coordinates
        explanation1 = Text("Use polar coordinates to solve", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Setting up polar coordinates
        polar_setup = MathTex(r"= \left(\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} e^{-x^2} \,dx\right)^2")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), polar_setup))
        self.wait(1)

        # Showing integral over a circle
        circle_integral = MathTex(r"= \int \int e^{-(x^2 + y^2)} \,dx\,dy")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(polar_setup, circle_integral))
        self.wait(1)

        # Transform to polar coordinates
        polar_transform = MathTex(r"= \int_0^{2\pi} \int_0^{\infty} e^{-r^2} r \,dr\,d\theta")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(circle_integral, polar_transform))
        self.wait(1)

        # Integration in polar coordinates
        integration_polar = MathTex(r"= \pi")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(polar_transform, integration_polar))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for taking the square root
        explanation2 = Text("Taking the square root of the result", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Final solution
        final_solution = MathTex(r"= \sqrt{\pi}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(integration_polar, final_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Clear the scene and conclude
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)
        self.play(Write(final_solution))
        self.wait(1) </s>

# Function to create a cookie circle
def CookieCircle():
    return VGroup(
        Circle(radius=1, color=TEXT_COLOR, fill_opacity=1),
        Dot(point=UP, color=BACKGROUND_COLOR),
        Dot(point=DOWN, color=BACKGROUND_COLOR),
        Dot(point=RIGHT, color=BACKGROUND_COLOR),

class CookiePartition(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        self.camera.background_color = BACKGROUND_COLOR

        title = Tex("Dividing cookie into 4 parts", color=LIGHT_BLUE_COLOR)
        title.scale(1.3).to_edge(UP)
        
        cookie = CookieCircle()
        partition_lines = VGroup(
            Line(UP, DOWN, color=BACKGROUND_COLOR),
            Line(LEFT, RIGHT, color=BACKGROUND_COLOR),
        )
        
        partitioned_cookie = VGroup(cookie, partition_lines)
        
        self.play(Write(title))
        self.play(FadeIn(cookie))
        self.wait(0.5)
        
        for line in partition_lines:
            self.play(Write(line), run_time=0.5)
        
        self.play(partitioned_cookie.animate.scale(0.7).shift(3 * LEFT + 2 * UP))
        
        fraction_group = VGroup()
        
        # Add fractions to indicate parts of the cookie
        for i in range(4):
            frac = MathTex(rf"\frac{1}{{4}}", color=LIGHT_BLUE_COLOR).scale(0.5)
            pos = cookie.get_critical_point([UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT][i]) + frac.get_width() * [DOWN, UP, RIGHT, LEFT][i]
            frac.move_to(pos)
            fraction_group.add(frac)
        
        self.play(AnimationGroup(*[FadeIn(f) for f in fraction_group], lag_ratio=0.3))
        
        self.wait(1)
        self.play(Uncreate(title), FadeOut(partitioned_cookie), FadeOut(fraction_group))
        self.wait(0.5) </s>

class BasicDefiniteIntegral(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Define lower and upper bounds
        a = 1
        b = 2

        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_{", str(a), r"}^{", str(b), r"} x^2 \,dx")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for the integration rule
        explanation1 = Text("Using the power rule of integration with bounds:", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Demonstrating the power rule
        power_rule = MathTex(r"\int_{a}^{b} x^n \,dx = \left. \frac{x^{n+1}}{n+1} \right|_{a}^{b}")
        self.play(Write(power_rule))
        self.wait(2)

        # Performing the integration step
        integration_step = MathTex(r"\left. \frac{x^{3}}{3} \right|_{", str(a), "}^{", str(b), "}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), integration_step))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for evaluating the definite integral
        explanation2 = Text("Evaluate the expression at bounds", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Calculation step
        calc_step = MathTex(r"= \frac{", str(b), r"^3}{3} - \frac{", str(a), r"^3}{3}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(integration_step, calc_step))
        self.wait(2)

        # Final solution with numerical values
        final_solution_numeric = MathTex(r"= \frac{8}{3} - \frac{1}{3}")
        self.play(Transform(calc_step, final_solution_numeric))
        self.wait(1)

        # Reduce to the simplest form
        final_solution_simple = MathTex(r"= \frac{7}{3}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(final_solution_numeric, final_solution_simple))
        self.wait(1)

        # Clear the scene
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)

        # Conclude with the final solution
        self.play(Write(final_solution_simple))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class AtomDiagram(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Create a grid of atoms
        grid = self.create_atom_grid(5, 5)
        # Animate the grid
        self.play(Create(grid))
        # Wait for two seconds
        self.wait(2)
    
    def create_atom_circle(self, label: str, atom_color: str, label_color: str = WHITE):
        circle = Circle(radius=0.3, color=atom_color, fill_opacity=1)
        text = Tex(label, color=label_color).scale(0.7)
        return VGroup(circle, text)
    
    def create_atom_grid(self, rows: int, cols: int):
        grid = VGroup()
        for i in range(rows):
            for j in range(cols):
                if (i + j) % 2 == 0:
                    atom = self.create_atom_circle("H", RED_B)
                else:
                    atom = self.create_atom_circle("He", BLUE_B)
                atom.move_to(np.array([i - rows // 2, j - cols // 2, 0]))
                grid.add(atom)
        return grid

class ElectronOrbit(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Create a proton
        proton = self.create_atom_circle("+", RED_A)
        # Create an electron
        electron = self.create_atom_circle("-", BLUE_D)
        # Create an orbit
        orbit = self.create_orbit()
        # Position electron at a specific point on the orbit
        electron.move_to(orbit.points[0])

        # Animate the proton, electron and its orbit
        self.play(FadeIn(proton), Create(orbit))
        self.play(FadeIn(electron))
        # Electron orbits around the proton
        self.play(MoveAlongPath(electron, orbit, rate_func=linear, run_time=5))
        # Wait for two seconds
        self.wait(2)

    def create_atom_circle(self, label: str, atom_color: str):
        circle = Circle(radius=0.2, color=atom_color, fill_opacity=1)
        text = Tex(label, color=WHITE).scale(0.5)
        return VGroup(circle, text)
    
    def create_orbit(self):
        orbit = Ellipse(width=3, height=1.5, color=WHITE).shift(DOWN*0.5)
        return orbit </s>

class BasicDefiniteIntegral(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_0^2 x^3 \,dx")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Display the limits of integration
        limits = Text("Integration bounds: from 0 to 2", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(limits))
        self.wait(2)

        # Explanation for the integration rule
        explanation1 = Text("Apply the power rule, add 1 to the exponent and divide by the new exponent:", font_size=24).next_to(limits, DOWN)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Demonstrating the power rule
        power_rule = MathTex(r"\int x^n \,dx = \frac{x^{n+1}}{n+1}")
        self.play(Write(power_rule))
        self.wait(2)

        # Performing the integration step
        solution1 = MathTex(r"=\frac{x^{3+1}}{4}\Bigg|_0^2")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), solution1))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for inserting the limits
        explanation2 = Text("Evaluate at the upper and lower bounds:", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Calculate the definite integral
        evaluated_solution = MathTex(r"=\frac{2^4}{4} - \frac{0^4}{4}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(solution1, evaluated_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Simplify the final solution
        explanation3 = Text("Simplify to find the area under the curve between the bounds", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation2, explanation3))
        self.wait(2)

        final_solution = MathTex(r"= 4")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(evaluated_solution, final_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Clear the scene
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)

        # Conclude with the final solution
        result_text = Text("The area under the curve from 0 to 2 is 4", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(result_text))
        self.play(Write(final_solution))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class WaveEquationExample(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial t^2} = c^2 \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2}")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for the type of equation
        explanation1 = Text("This is the one-dimensional wave equation.", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(FadeIn(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # General solution explanation
        explanation2 = Text("The general solution can be written as u(x, t) = f(x - ct) + g(x + ct)", font_size=24).move_to(explanation1)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Displaying the general solution
        general_solution = MathTex(r"u(x, t) = f(x - ct) + g(x + ct)")
        general_solution.next_to(problem, DOWN)
        self.play(Write(general_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for the d'Alembert's formula
        explanation3 = Text("This is known as d'Alembert's formula.", font_size=24).move_to(explanation1)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation3))
        self.wait(2)

        # Showing d'Alembert's formula
        dalemberts_formula = MathTex(r"u(x, t) = \frac{1}{2}[f(x - ct) + f(x + ct)] + \frac{1}{2c}\int_{x-ct}^{x+ct} g(s) ds")
        dalemberts_formula.next_to(general_solution, DOWN)
        self.play(Write(dalemberts_formula))
        self.wait(1)

        # Clear the scene and show final formula
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)
        self.play(Write(dalemberts_formula))
        self.wait(1) </s>

            x_range=[0, 3, 1],
            y_range=[0, 3, 1],

        self.play(ReplacementTransform(integration_step, final_solution))

class RNNSequenceScene(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Create a sequence of numbers as input
        sequence = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
        sequence_mob = VGroup(*[MathTex(str(num)) for num in sequence])
        sequence_mob.arrange_in_grid(rows=1, buff=1)
        self.play(Write(sequence_mob))
        
        # Move the sequence off to the side
        self.play(sequence_mob.animate.to_edge(UP))

        # Neural Network with LSTM Cells
        nn = NeuralNetwork(
            [
                FeedForwardLayer(5), # Input layer corresponding to the sequence length
                LSTMCellLayer(),    # LSTM cell layer
                FeedForwardLayer(5), # Output layer
            ],
            node_spacing=0.1,
            layer_spacing=0.4
        )
        
        nn.move_to(ORIGIN)
        self.play(Write(nn))
        
        # Play a forward pass animation through the RNN
        forward_pass = nn.make_forward_pass_animation()
        self.play(forward_pass)

        # Isolate a Neuron and show its connections
        focus_neuron = nn.all_layers[1].neurons[0]
        connections = VGroup(*[
            conn for conn in nn.connections
            if conn.start_node is focus_neuron or conn.end_node is focus_neuron
        ])
        self.play(FocusOn(focus_neuron))
        self.play(LaggedStart(*[ShowCreationThenFadeOut(conn) for conn in connections]))

        # Display the updated sequence after RNN transformation
        updated_sequence_mob = VGroup(*[MathTex(str(num+5)) for num in sequence])
        updated_sequence_mob.next_to(nn, DOWN, buff=1)
        self.play(Transform(sequence_mob, updated_sequence_mob))

class PythagoreanProof(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the Pythagorean theorem
        theorem = MathTex('a^2 + b^2 = c^2')
        self.play(Write(theorem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Draw right triangle
        right_triangle = RightAngleTriangle()
        self.play(Create(right_triangle))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explaining the square on the hypotenuse
        explanation1 = Text("Consider squares on each side", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Creating squares on each side of the triangle
        square_a = Square().scale(0.5).next_to(right_triangle, UP, buff=0)
        square_b = Square().scale(0.5).next_to(right_triangle, RIGHT, buff=0)
        square_c = Square().scale(0.7).next_to(right_triangle.hypotenuse, RIGHT, buff=0)
        self.play(Create(square_a), Create(square_b), Create(square_c))
        self.wait(2)

        # Explaining Pythagorean theorem in this context
        explanation2 = Text("Area of c^2 is equal to sum of a^2 and b^2", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # The conclusion
        conclusion = MathTex('a^2', '+', 'b^2', '=', 'c^2').move_to(DOWN * 3)
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(theorem.copy(), conclusion))
        self.wait(1)

        # Clear the scene and show the conclusion again
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)
        conclusion_final = MathTex('a^2 + b^2 = c^2').move_to(DOWN * 3)
        self.play(Write(conclusion_final))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class ExponentIntegrationExample(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int x^2 e^x \,dx")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for using integration by parts
        explanation1 = Text("Use integration by parts", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Integration by parts formula
        parts_formula = MathTex(r"\int u \,dv = uv - \int v \,du")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), parts_formula))
        self.wait(1)

        # Define u and dv
        u_and_dv = MathTex(r"u=x^2", r", \quad dv=e^x\,dx")
        self.play(Write(u_and_dv))
        self.wait(2)

        # Define du and v
        du_and_v = MathTex(r"du=2x \,dx", r", \quad v=e^x")
        self.play(Transform(u_and_dv, du_and_v))
        self.wait(2)

        # Apply the formula
        substitute_parts = MathTex(r"x^2 e^x - \int 2x e^x \,dx")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(parts_formula, substitute_parts))
        self.wait(2)

        # Solve the remaining integral
        final_integration = MathTex(r"x^2 e^x - \left( 2xe^x - 2\int e^x \,dx \right)")
        self.play(Transform(substitute_parts, final_integration))
        self.wait(2)

        # Final solution
        final_solution = MathTex(r"= x^2 e^x - 2xe^x + 2e^x + C")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(final_integration, final_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Clear the scene and conclude
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)
        self.play(Write(final_solution))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class MoleculeMovementScene(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Create a grid of atoms representing a molecule
        molecule_grid = self.create_molecule_grid(rows=3, cols=3)
        molecule_grid.move_to(ORIGIN)
        self.add(molecule_grid)

        # Randomly move an electron around the molecule grid
        moving_electron = electron().shift(LEFT * 2 + UP * 2)
        self.add(moving_electron)

        # Define complex path for the electron to move along
        path_points = [
            UR * 2, RIGHT * 2 + DOWN, UP + LEFT * 2, DOWN * 2 + RIGHT, ORIGIN
        ]

        # Move the electron along the path
        self.play(
            *move_along_complex_path(moving_electron, stop_indices=[1, 3], points=path_points, run_time=2)
        )
        self.wait(1)

    def create_molecule_grid(self, rows: int, cols: int) -> Mobject:
        # Create a grid of alternating positive and negative ions
        grid = VGroup()
        for i in range(rows):
            for j in range(cols):
                ion = positive() if (i + j) % 2 == 0 else negative()
                ion.move_to(i * RIGHT + j * UP)
                grid.add(ion)
        return grid.shift(DOWN + LEFT) </s>

class TripleIntegralExample(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_{0}^{1} \int_{0}^{2} \int_{0}^{3} xyz \,dz\,dx\,dy")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for inner integral
        explanation1 = Text("First, integrate with respect to z", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Inner integral step
        inner_integral = MathTex(r"= \int_{0}^{1} \int_{0}^{2} [\frac{1}{2}x y z^2]_{0}^{3} \,dx\,dy")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), inner_integral))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for middle integral
        explanation2 = Text("Next, integrate with respect to x", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Middle integral step
        middle_integral = MathTex(r"= \int_{0}^{1} [\frac{3}{2} x^2 y]_{0}^{2} \,dy")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(inner_integral, middle_integral))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for outer integral
        explanation3 = Text("Finally, integrate with respect to y", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation3))
        self.wait(2)

        # Outer integral step and final solution
        final_solution = MathTex(r"= [\frac{3}{2} y^2]_{0}^{1}", r"= \frac{3}{2}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(middle_integral, final_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Conclusion
        conclusion = Text("The triple integral evaluates to 3/2", font_size=24)
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)
        self.play(Write(conclusion))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class BatteryAnimation(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        anode = self.create_electrode("Anode", LEFT * 2)
        cathode = self.create_electrode("Cathode", RIGHT * 2)
        battery = VGroup(anode, cathode)
        self.add(battery)

        electron_path = self.get_electron_path(LEFT * 2, RIGHT * 2, 3)
        electron = electron().move_to(anode)
        self.play(*move_along_complex_path(electron, [], electron_path, run_time=5, rate_func=there_and_back))

    def create_electrode(self, label_text, position):
        electrode = Rectangle(height=3, width=1, fill_opacity=1, fill_color=DARK_GREY)
        label = Tex(label_text, color=WHITE)
        electrode_group = VGroup(electrode, label).arrange(DOWN)
        electrode_group.move_to(position)
        return electrode_group

    def get_electron_path(self, start_point, end_point, num_curves):
        path = [start_point]
        for i in range(num_curves):
            path.append(path[-1] + UP if i % 2 == 0 else path[-1] + DOWN)
            path.append(end_point if i % 2 == 0 else start_point)
        return path

class FibonacciSpiral(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        colors = it.cycle([
            "#f55e61",
            "#408ef5",
            "#e3883d",
            "#a346eb",
            "#0dc786"
        ])

        fib_numbers = [0, 1]
        for _ in range(7):
            fib_numbers.append(fib_numbers[-1] + fib_numbers[-2])
        
        squares = VGroup()
        for index, number in enumerate(fib_numbers[2:]):
            color = next(colors)
            square = Square(side_length=number).set_stroke(color, width=3).set_fill(color, opacity=0.5)
            squares.add(square)
        
        squares.arrange_in_grid(buf=0)
        center_of_spiral = squares.get_center()
        
        self.play(AnimationGroup(*[FadeIn(square, shift=0.5*UP) for square in squares], lag_ratio=0.2))
        self.wait()
        
        arcs = VGroup()
        for s1, s2 in zip(squares[:-1], squares[1:]):
            angle = 90 * DEGREES if s2.get_y() < s1.get_y() else -90 * DEGREES
            radius = abs(s1.get_width() - s2.get_width()) / 2
            arc = Arc(radius=radius, angle=angle, arc_center=s1.get_center())
            arc.move_arc_center_to(s1.get_center())
            arcs.add(arc)
        
        arcs.set_color_by_gradient(RED, ORANGE, YELLOW, GREEN, BLUE, PURPLE)
        self.play(AnimationGroup(*[ShowCreation(arc) for arc in arcs], lag_ratio=0.4))
        self.wait()

        last_square = squares[-1]
        circles = VGroup()
        for n in fib_numbers[2:]:
            circle = Circle(radius=n/2).set_stroke(BLACK, width=3)
            circle.move_to(last_square)
            last_square = circle
            circles.add(circle)
        
        self.play(AnimationGroup(*[FadeIn(circle) for circle in circles], lag_ratio=0.7))
        self.wait(2) </s>

class AreaUnderCurve(Scene):

            x_range=[0, 5],
            y_range=[0, 10],
            axis_config={"color": BLUE},
        )
        axes_labels = axes.get_axis_labels(x_label="x", y_label="f(x)")

        # Creating the curve f(x) = x^2 and the area under the curve
        curve = axes.plot(lambda x: x**2, color=GREEN)

        self.play(FadeIn(area, scale=0.5))
        self.wait(1)

        # Problem statement
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_0^2 x^2 \,dx").next_to(area, DOWN)
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Calculation

                              r"= \frac{2^3}{3} - \frac{0^3}{3}",

        self.play(Write(calculation[0]))

        self.wait(1)
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(calculation[1], calculation[2]))
        self.wait(2)

        # Clear and show final result

        self.play(Write(curve_label), Write(calculation[2]))

class BasicDefiniteIntegral(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_0^1 x^2 \,dx")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for the integration rule
        explanation = Text("Evaluating the definite integral:", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation))
        self.wait(2)

        # Power rule for definite integrals
        power_rule_definite = MathTex(r"\int_a^b x^n \,dx = \left. \frac{x^{n+1}}{n+1} \right|_a^b")
        self.play(Write(power_rule_definite))
        self.wait(2)

        # Evaluating the limits
        limits_eval = MathTex(r"=\left. \frac{x^{3}}{3} \right|_0^1")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), limits_eval))
        self.wait(1)

        # Solution after limits are substituted
        solution = MathTex(r"= \frac{1^{3}}{3} - \frac{0^{3}}{3}")
        self.play(Transform(limits_eval, solution))
        self.wait(2)

        # Final solution
        final_solution = MathTex(r"= \frac{1}{3}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(solution, final_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Show final answer
        final_answer = Text("The area under the curve from 0 to 1 is 1/3.", font_size=24).next_to(final_solution, DOWN)
        self.play(Write(final_answer))
        self.wait(2)

        # Clear the scene
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)

        # Conclude with the final answer
        self.play(Write(final_solution), Write(final_answer))
        self.wait(1) </s>

def FibonacciSquare(size, color):
    rect = Square(size / 5, color=color)

    text = Tex(f"{size}", color=color)
    text.scale(3 * min(1, size / 12))
    text.move_to(rect)

    return Group(rect, text)

class SumPattern(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        self.camera.background_color = BACKGROUND_COLOR

        title = Group(
            Tex("Observe a sequência", color=LIGHT_RED_COLOR),
            Tex("abaixo:", color=LIGHT_RED_COLOR)
        )
        title.arrange(DOWN)
        title.scale(1.8)
        title.shift(3.5 * UP)
        pattern_text = Tex("1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, ...", color=TEXT_COLOR)
        pattern_text.scale(1.5)
        previous_arc = None
        previous_arc_text = None

        self.play(
            FadeIn(title), 
            FadeIn(pattern_text), 
            run_time=0.5
        )
        self.wait(0.3)
        self.play(Circumscribe(pattern_text[0][0], color=LIGHT_RED_COLOR, run_time=2.5))

        for i in range(7):
            start = -2.7 + i * 0.85
            end = start - 0.8

            if i % 2 == 0:
                y = 0.5
                direction = UP
            else:
                y = -0.5
                direction = DOWN

            arc = ArcBetweenPoints([start, y, 0], [end, y, 0], color=LIGHT_RED_COLOR)
            arc.flip(UP)

            if i % 2 == 1: 
                arc.flip(RIGHT)

            arc.add_tip(tip_shape=ArrowTriangleFilledTip)
            arc_text = Tex("+1", color=LIGHT_RED_COLOR)
            arc_text.scale(0.8)
            arc_text.next_to(arc, direction)

            if previous_arc is None:
                self.play(FadeIn(Group(arc_text, arc)), run_time=0.2)
            else:
                self.play(
                    Transform(previous_arc_text.copy().set_opacity(0), arc_text), 
                    Transform(previous_arc.copy().set_opacity(0), arc),
                    rate_func=rate_functions.rush_from,
                    run_time=0.3
                )

            previous_arc_text = arc_text
            previous_arc = arc
            self.wait(0.5)

        self.wait(0.5)
        self.play(FadeOut(Group(*self.mobjects[1:]), run_time=0.5))
        self.remove(*self.mobjects) </s>

class SquareWithText(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        s = self.square_with_text(2, "Manim", RED, 36, WHITE, 3, YELLOW)
        self.play(Create(s))
        self.wait(2)

    def square_with_text(
        self, side_length: float, txt: str, color=WHITE, font_size: int = 48,
        font_color=BLACK, stroke_width: int = 2, fill_color=WHITE

        t = Text(txt, stroke_width=stroke_width, font_size=font_size, color=font_color)
        return VGroup(sqr, t).move_to(ORIGIN) </s>

class HydrogenGrid(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        rows, cols = 5, 6
        hydrogen_grid = VGroup(*[self.hydrogen_atom().move_to([j - rows//2, i - cols//2, 0]) 
                                 for i in range(rows) for j in range(cols)])
        self.add(hydrogen_grid)
    
    def hydrogen_atom(self) -> Mobject:
        electron = Circle(radius=0.1, color=BLUE).set_fill(BLUE, opacity=1)
        proton = Circle(radius=0.15, color=RED).set_fill(RED, opacity=1)
        text_e = Text("e-", color=WHITE, font_size=18).move_to(electron.get_center())
        text_p = Text("p+", color=WHITE, font_size=18).move_to(proton.get_center())
        return VGroup(electron, text_e, proton, text_p).arrange(RIGHT, buff=0.25)
 </s>

        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_{0}^{2\pi} \int_{0}^{1} r dr\,d\theta")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for inner integral
        explanation1 = Text("Integrate with respect to r first", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Inner integral step
        inner_integral = MathTex(r"= \int_{0}^{2\pi} [\frac{1}{2}r^2]_{0}^{1} d\theta")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), inner_integral))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for final integral
        explanation2 = Text("Integrate with respect to \(\\theta\) now", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Final solution
        final_solution = MathTex(r"= \frac{1}{2} \int_{0}^{2\pi} d\theta")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(inner_integral, final_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Computing the final integral
        computed_solution = MathTex(r"= \frac{1}{2} [ \theta ]_{0}^{2\pi}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(final_solution, computed_solution))
        self.wait(1)
        
        # Displaying the final answer
        answer = MathTex(r"= \pi")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(computed_solution, answer))

class FourierSeriesExample(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Display the Fourier Series formula

        self.play(Write(formula))
        self.wait(2)

        self.wait(2)

        self.wait(2)

        # Explanation of Convergence

        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Clearing the explanation and showing the plot

        self.play(ShowCreation(formula))

        # Plot of a periodic function using Fourier series

class AreaUnderCurveExample(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Display the function and the area under the curve
        function = MathTex(r"f(x) = x^2")
        area = MathTex(r"A = \int_{a}^{b} f(x) \,dx")
        self.play(Write(function))
        self.wait(1)
        self.play(Write(area))
        self.wait(2)

        # Show the definite integral bounds
        bounds = MathTex(r"a=1, \quad b=2")
        self.play(Write(bounds))
        self.wait(2)

        # Perform the definite integral
        definite_integral = MathTex(r"A = \int_{1}^{2} x^2 \,dx")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(area, definite_integral))
        self.wait(2)

        # Solve the definite integral
        solved_integral = MathTex(r"A = \left.\frac{x^3}{3}\right|_{1}^{2}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(definite_integral, solved_integral))
        self.wait(2)

        # Calculate the area value
        area_value = MathTex(r"A = \frac{2^3}{3} - \frac{1^3}{3}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(solved_integral, area_value))
        self.wait(2)

        # Simplify the result
        simplified_result = MathTex(r"A = \frac{7}{3}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(area_value, simplified_result))
        self.wait(2)

        # Conclusion
        conclusion = Text("The area under the curve is 7/3.", font_size=24).to_edge(DOWN)
        self.play(Write(conclusion))
        self.wait(2)

        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)
        self.play(Write(simplified_result), Write(conclusion))
        self.wait(1) </s>

        self.wait(1)

        self.wait(2)

        self.wait(1)

        self.wait(1)

        # Displaying the final answer
        self.play(Write(solution))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class OscillationScene(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        title = Text("Simple Harmonic Motion", font_size=34)
        self.play(Write(title))
        self.wait(1)

        # Display the equation of motion
        equation = MathTex(r"m\frac{d^2x}{dt^2} + kx = 0")
        self.play(Write(equation))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation of the terms
        explanation1 = Tex(
            "Where $m$ is mass, \\",
            "$\\frac{d^2x}{dt^2}$ is acceleration, \\",
            "and $k$ is the spring constant.",
            font_size=24
        ).next_to(equation, DOWN)

        self.play(FadeIn(explanation1, shift=UP))
        self.wait(2)

        # Forming the characteristic equation
        char_eq = MathTex(r"r^2 + \omega^2 = 0", r"\quad \text{where } \omega = \sqrt{\frac{k}{m}}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(equation.copy(), char_eq[0]))
        self.wait(1)
        self.play(Write(char_eq[1]))
        self.wait(2)

        # General solution with sine and cosine
        general_solution = MathTex(r"x(t) = A\cos(\omega t) + B\sin(\omega t)")
        self.play(FadeOut(explanation1), ReplacementTransform(char_eq, general_solution))
        self.wait(2)

        # Explanation for general solution
        explanation2 = Tex("General solution with arbitrary constants $A$ and $B$.", font_size=24).to_edge(DOWN)
        self.play(Write(explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Clear scene for final representation
        self.clear()
        self.play(Write(general_solution))
        explanation3 = Tex("This represents the position $x(t)$ over time.", font_size=24).to_edge(DOWN)
        self.play(Write(explanation3))
        self.wait(2) </s>

class AreaUnderCurveExample(Scene):

            lambda x: 0.1 * x**2 - 1,
            x_range=[-3, 3],
            color=BLUE
        )

        equation = MathTex(r"\int_{-3}^{3} 0.1x^2 - 1 \, dx")
        equation.to_edge(UP)

        self.play(Write(equation))
        self.wait(1)

        self.wait(1)

        self.play(Write(area))
        self.wait(2)

        solution = MathTex(r"= \left[\frac{0.1}{3}x^3 - x\right]_{-3}^{3}")

        self.play(Write(final_answer))
        self.wait(2)

        final_evaluation = MathTex(r"= 0")
        final_evaluation.add_updater(lambda m: m.next_to(final_answer, DOWN))

        self.play(ReplacementTransform(final_answer, final_evaluation))
        self.wait(2) </s>

class AreaUnderCurveExample(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Writing the function and the area to find
        function_tex = MathTex(r"f(x) = x^2")
        area_tex = MathTex(r"\int_0^2 x^2 \,dx")
        problem_group = VGroup(function_tex, area_tex).arrange(DOWN)
        self.play(Write(problem_group))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explain which area we want to find
        explanation_text = Text("Finding area under curve from 0 to 2", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation_text))
        self.wait(2)

        # Draw graph
        axes = Axes(x_range=[0, 3], y_range=[0, 5], axis_config={"include_tip": True})
        graph = axes.plot(lambda x: x**2, color=BLUE)
        area = axes.get_area(graph, x_range=(0,2), color=BLUE, opacity=0.3)
        graph_group = VGroup(axes, graph, area)
        self.play(Create(graph_group))
        self.wait(1)

        # Do the calculation
        calculation = MathTex(r"= \frac{1}{3} x^3 \Bigg|_0^2")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(area_tex.copy(), calculation))
        self.wait(1)

        # Final answer after calculation
        final_answer = MathTex(r"= \frac{1}{3} (2)^3 - \frac{1}{3} (0)^3", r"= \frac{8}{3}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(calculation, final_answer))
        self.wait(1)

        # Highlight final answer
        box = SurroundingRectangle(final_answer, color=RED)
        self.play(Create(box))
        self.wait(2)

        # Clear and show final answer only
        self.clear()
        self.play(Write(final_answer))
        self.wait(2) </s>

class DoubleIntegralPolarExample(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_{0}^{\pi/2} \int_{0}^{1} \rho^2 \sin(\phi) d\rho\,d\phi")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for inner integral
        explanation1 = Text("Integrate with respect to rho first", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Inner integral step
        inner_integral = MathTex(r"= \int_{0}^{\pi/2} [\frac{1}{3}\rho^3 \sin(\phi)]_{0}^{1} d\phi")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), inner_integral))
        self.wait(1)

        # Simplified inner integral step
        simplified_inner_integral = MathTex(r"= \int_{0}^{\pi/2} \frac{1}{3} \sin(\phi) d\phi")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(inner_integral, simplified_inner_integral))
        self.wait(1)
        
        # Explanation for final integral
        explanation2 = Text("Now integrate with respect to phi", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Final solution
        final_solution = MathTex(r"= [\frac{1}{3} (-\cos(\phi))]_{0}^{\pi/2}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(simplified_inner_integral, final_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Calculation of the final result
        final_result = MathTex(r"= \frac{1}{3} (1 - (-1)) = \frac{2}{3}")
        self.play(Write(final_result))
        self.wait(2)
        
        # Complete Scene
        complete_scene = VGroup(explanation2, final_solution, final_result).arrange(DOWN)
        self.play(Transform(VGroup(explanation1, simplified_inner_integral, final_result), complete_scene))
        self.wait(3) </s>

class FourierSeriesExample(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the Fourier Series formula
        fourier_series = MathTex(r"f(x) = a_0 + \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_n \cos(nx) + b_n \sin(nx)")
        self.play(Write(fourier_series))
        self.wait(2)

        # Explanation of Fourier Series
        explanation1 = Text("Fourier Series represents periodic functions.", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Explaining coefficients
        explanation2 = Text("The coefficients a_n and b_n are specific to the function's shape.", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(3)

        # Displaying the formula for coefficients
        coefficients = MathTex(r"a_n = \frac{2}{T} \int_{0}^{T} f(x) \cos(nx) dx", r"\\",
                               r"b_n = \frac{2}{T} \int_{0}^{T} f(x) \sin(nx) dx"
        ).next_to(fourier_series, DOWN)
        self.play(Write(coefficients))
        self.wait(3)

        # Explanation of convergence
        explanation3 = Text("The series converges to f(x) as n approaches infinity.", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation3))
        self.wait(3)

        # Clear the scene and conclude
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)
        conclusion = Text("Fourier Series decompose periodic functions into harmonic components.", font_size=24)
        self.play(Write(conclusion))
        self.wait(3) </s>

class TripleIntegralExample(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_{0}^{1} \int_{0}^{1} \int_{0}^{1} xyz \,dx\,dy\,dz")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for innermost integral
        explanation1 = Text("First, integrate with respect to x", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Innermost integral step
        inner_integral_x = MathTex(r"= \int_{0}^{1} \int_{0}^{1} [\frac{1}{2}x^2yz]_{0}^{1} \,dy\,dz")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), inner_integral_x))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for middle integral
        explanation2 = Text("Next, integrate the result with respect to y", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Middle integral step
        middle_integral_y = MathTex(r"= \int_{0}^{1} [\frac{1}{2}y^2z]_{0}^{1} \,dz")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(inner_integral_x, middle_integral_y))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for outermost integral
        explanation3 = Text("Finally, integrate the result with respect to z", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation3))
        self.wait(2)

        # Outermost integral step and final solution
        final_solution = MathTex(r"= \int_{0}^{1} \frac{1}{2}z \,dz", r"= [\frac{1}{4}z^2]_{0}^{1}", r"= \frac{1}{4}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(middle_integral_y, final_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Clear the scene and conclude
        self.play(FadeOut(explanation1, shift=DOWN), FadeOut(final_solution, shift=DOWN))
        self.wait(1)
        conclusion = Text("The triple integral evaluates to 1/4", font_size=24)
        self.play(Write(conclusion))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class CNNVisualizationScene(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        image_path = "path/to/your/image.png"
        image = Image.open(image_path)
        numpy_image = np.array(image)

        # Define layers for Convolutional Neural Network
        cnn_layers = [
            ImageLayer(numpy_image, height=2),
            ConvolutionalLayer(num_kernels=5, kernel_size=(3, 3), stride=1),
            FeedForwardLayer(128),
            FeedForwardLayer(64),
            FeedForwardLayer(3)  # Assuming an output of 3 classes
        ]

        # Initialize Neural Network
        cnn = NeuralNetwork(cnn_layers, layer_spacing=0.5)

        # Scale and Position the CNN
        cnn.scale(0.8)
        cnn.to_edge(UP)

        # Add CNN to the scene
        self.play(FadeIn(cnn))

        # Animate the forward pass
        self.play(cnn.make_forward_pass_animation(), run_time=5)

        # Pause to observe the result
        self.wait(2)

# Run the scene
scene = CNNVisualizationScene()
scene.render() </s>

class BasicDefiniteIntegral(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_2^3 x^3 \,dx")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for the integration rule
        explanation1 = Text("Using the power rule of integration:", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Demonstrating the power rule
        power_rule = MathTex(r"\int x^n \,dx = \frac{x^{n+1}}{n+1} + C")
        self.play(Write(power_rule))
        self.wait(2)

        # Display the limits of integration
        limits = MathTex(r"[2^4/4, 3^4/4]")
        self.play(Write(limits))
        self.wait(2)

        # Evaluating the definite integral
        solution1 = MathTex(r"= \frac{3^4}{4} - \frac{2^4}{4}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), solution1))
        self.wait(1)

        # Simplifying the result
        explanation2 = Text("Simplifying the result:", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Final solution
        final_solution = MathTex(r"= \frac{81}{4} - \frac{16}{4}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(solution1, final_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Further simplification
        final_answer = MathTex(r"= \frac{65}{4}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(final_solution, final_answer))
        self.wait(1)

        # Clear the scene
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)

        # Conclude with the final answer
        self.play(Write(final_answer))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class BasicDefiniteIntegral(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_0^2 x^3 \,dx")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for the integration rule
        explanation1 = Text("Using the power rule of integration:", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Demonstrating the power rule
        power_rule = MathTex(r"\int x^n \,dx = \frac{x^{n+1}}{n+1}")
        self.play(Write(power_rule))
        self.wait(2)

        # Performing the integration step
        solution1 = MathTex(r"= \frac{x^{3+1}}{4}\Big|_0^2")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), solution1))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for evaluating the definite integral
        explanation2 = Text("Evaluate at the boundaries 0 and 2", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Evaluating the definite integral
        evaluation = MathTex(r"= \left(\frac{2^{4}}{4}\right) - \left(\frac{0^{4}}{4}\right)")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(solution1, evaluation))
        self.wait(2)

        # Final solution
        final_solution = MathTex(r"= 4")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(evaluation, final_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Clear the scene
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)

        # Conclude with the final solution
        conclusion = Text("The definite integral evaluates to 4", font_size=36)
        self.play(Write(conclusion))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class DefiniteIntegral(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Introduce the definite integral problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_{a}^{b} x dx")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explain the integral boundaries
        boundaries_explanation = Text("Evaluating from 'a' to 'b':", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(boundaries_explanation))
        self.wait(2)

        # Show fundamental theorem of calculus
        theorem = MathTex(r"F(b) - F(a)", "=", r"\left. \frac{x^{n+1}}{n+1} \right|_{a}^{b}")
        self.play(Write(theorem))
        self.wait(2)

        # Perform the definite integral calculation
        solution = MathTex(r"=", r"\frac{b^2}{2}", "-", r"\frac{a^2}{2}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Highlight the result
        highlight_box = SurroundingRectangle(solution[-2:], buff=.1)
        self.play(Create(highlight_box))
        self.wait(2)

        # Clear everything
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)

        # Present the final result of the integral
        final_result = MathTex(r"\int_{a}^{b} x dx", "=", r"\frac{b^2}{2} - \frac{a^2}{2}")
        self.play(Write(final_result))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class AreaUnderCurve(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Define the function and its graph
        func = lambda x: 0.1 * (x - 3) ** 2
        graph = FunctionGraph(func, x_range=[0, 5])
        self.play(ShowCreation(graph))
        self.wait(1)

        # Display the problem on the scene
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_0^5 0.1(x-3)^2 \,dx")
        problem.to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation to show the area under the curve
        area_explain = Text("Shaded area represents the integral", font_size=24).next_to(problem, DOWN)
        self.play(Write(area_explain))
        self.wait(2)

        # Shade the area under the graph
        area = Integral(func, (x, 0, 5)).set_color(BLUE)
        self.play(ShowCreation(area))
        self.wait(2)

        # Calculate the integral
        integral_solution = MathTex(r"= \left[\frac{0.1}{3}(x-3)^3 \right]_0^5")
        integral_solution.next_to(area_explain, DOWN)
        self.play(Write(integral_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Evaluating the definite integral
        evaluation = MathTex(r"= \frac{0.1}{3}(5-3)^3 - \frac{0.1}{3}(0-3)^3")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(integral_solution, evaluation))
        self.wait(2)

        # Show final result
        final_result = MathTex(r"= 0.1(8) - 0.1(-27)", r"= 0.8 + 2.7", r"= 3.5")
        final_result.scale(0.8)
        final_result.next_to(evaluation, DOWN)
        self.play(Write(final_result))
        self.wait(1)

        # Clear the scene and display only the final result
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)
        self.play(Write(final_result))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class DoubleIntegralPolarExample(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_{0}^{\pi} \int_{0}^{1} r^2 \sin(\theta) dr\, d\theta")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for inner integral
        explanation1 = Text("Integrate with respect to r first", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Inner integral step
        inner_integral = MathTex(r"= \int_{0}^{\pi} [\frac{1}{3}r^3 \sin(\theta)]_{0}^{1} d\theta")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), inner_integral))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for final integral
        explanation2 = Text("Now integrate with respect to \(\\theta\)", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Final solution
        final_solution = MathTex(r"= \int_{0}^{\pi} \frac{1}{3} \sin(\theta) d\theta")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(inner_integral, final_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Computing the definite integral
        computed_solution = MathTex(r"= [\frac{1}{3} (-\cos(\theta))]_{0}^{\pi}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(final_solution, computed_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Result of the computation
        result = MathTex(r"= \frac{1}{3} (1 - (-1)) = \frac{2}{3}")
        self.play(Write(result))
        self.wait(2) </s>

class WaterMoleculeScene(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Define the positions of hydrogen and oxygen atoms
        oxygen_position = ORIGIN
        hydrogen_position1 = UP + RIGHT
        hydrogen_position2 = UP + LEFT
        
        # Create water molecule components

        self.wait(2)
        self.play(ApplyMethod(water_molecule.scale, 2))
        self.wait(2)
        self.play(FadeOut(water_molecule))

        # Create an oxygen atom with a red circle and "O" text in the center
        oxygen_circle = Circle(radius=0.5, color=RED).set_fill(RED, opacity=1)

        oxygen_atom = VGroup(oxygen_circle, oxygen_text).move_to(position)

        hydrogen_text = Tex("H", color=WHITE, font_size=20)
        hydrogen_atom = VGroup(hydrogen_circle, hydrogen_text).move_to(position)
        return hydrogen_atom

class BasicDefiniteIntegral(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_0^3 x^3 \,dx")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for the integration rule
        explanation1 = Text("Using the power rule of integration:", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Demonstrating the power rule
        power_rule = MathTex(r"\int x^n \,dx = \frac{x^{n+1}}{n+1}").shift(UP)
        self.play(Write(power_rule))
        self.wait(2)

        # Performing the integration step
        solution_step = MathTex(r"= \left. \frac{x^{3+1}}{3+1} \right|_0^3")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), solution_step))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for evaluating the integral
        explanation2 = Text("Evaluate at the bounds:", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Evaluating the integral
        evaluated_integral = MathTex(r"= \frac{3^4}{4} - \frac{0^4}{4}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(solution_step, evaluated_integral))
        self.wait(1)

        # Simplifying the evaluated integral
        simplified_solution = MathTex(r"= \frac{81}{4}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(evaluated_integral, simplified_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Clear the scene
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)

        # Conclude with the simplified solution
        self.play(Write(simplified_solution))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class DropOutScene(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Create a neural network
        nn = NeuralNetwork([
            FeedForwardLayer(4, neuron_radius=0.2, layer_spacing=0.5),
            FeedForwardLayer(6, neuron_radius=0.2, layer_spacing=0.5),
            FeedForwardLayer(4, neuron_radius=0.2, layer_spacing=0.5),
        ])

        # Position the neural network
        nn.move_to(ORIGIN)

        # Add the neural network to the scene
        self.add(nn)

        # Create a group of circles simulating dropout
        dropout_circles = VGroup(*[Circle(radius=0.2).move_to(neuron.get_center())
                                   for layer in nn.layers[1:-1]
                                   for neuron in layer.neurons])

        # Create fade in and out animations for each circle
        animations = [AnimationGroup(FadeIn(circle), FadeOut(circle)) for circle in dropout_circles]

        # Play the animations for dropout effect
        self.play(*animations, lag_ratio=0.1)

        # Wait before ending the scene
        self.wait(1) </s>

            y_range=[-3, 3, 1],

        self.wait(2)

        explanation = Tex(r"The tangent line at $x=1$ represents \\ the derivative of $x^2$, which is $2x$.")
        explanation.next_to(tangent_line, UP)
        explanation.shift(RIGHT*3)

        self.play(Write(explanation))
        self.wait(2) </s>

class AreaUnderCurve(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Define the function and its graph
        f = lambda x: 0.1 * x**2
        graph = FunctionGraph(f, x_range=[-3, 3], color=BLUE)

        # Display the graph
        graph_label = MathTex("y = 0.1 x^2").next_to(graph, UP)
        self.play(Create(graph), Write(graph_label))
        self.wait(1)

        # Highlight the area under the curve
        area = area = Integral(f, (x, -2, 2), fill_opacity=0.3, fill_color=GREEN)
        self.play(Create(area))
        self.wait(1)

        # Show the definite integral notation
        integral_notation = MathTex(r"\int_{-2}^{2} 0.1 x^2 \,dx").to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(integral_notation))
        self.wait(1)

        # Calculating the area under the curve
        calculation_steps = MathTex(r"= [ \frac{0.1 x^3}{3} ]_{-2}^{2}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(integral_notation.copy(), calculation_steps))
        self.wait(2)

        # Showing the final area
        solution = MathTex(r"= \frac{0.1 (2)^3}{3} - \frac{0.1 (-2)^3}{3}", r"= \frac{4}{30} + \frac{4}{30}", r"= \frac{8}{30} = \frac{4}{15}")
        solution.scale(0.75).next_to(calculation_steps, DOWN)
        self.play(Write(solution))
        self.wait(3)

        # Clear the scene
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)

        # Show just the solution at the end
        self.play(Write(solution))
        self.wait(2) </s>

class ChemistryScene(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Create grid of lithium ions
        li_grid = self.lithium_grid(3, 3)

        # Create a single carbon layer
        carbon_l = self.carbon_layer()

        # Create a molecule of oxygen and a metal
        oxy = self.oxygen().shift(LEFT * 2)
        met = self.metal().shift(RIGHT * 2)

        # Animate the objects
        self.play(FadeIn(li_grid))
        self.wait(1)
        self.play(Transform(li_grid, carbon_l))
        self.wait(1)
        self.play(FadeIn(oxy), FadeIn(met))
        self.wait(2)

        # Move the oxygen in a triangle path
        tri_points = [UP * 2 + LEFT, UP * 2, UP * 2 + RIGHT]
        oxy_animations = self.move_along_complex_path(oxy, [1], tri_points, run_time=3)
        self.play(*oxy_animations)

        self.wait(3)

    def move_along_complex_path(self, obj: Mobject, stop_indices, points, run_time: float, rate_func=linear):
        animations = []
        paths = []
        for i in range(len(points) - 1):
            if i not in stop_indices:
                paths.append(Line(points[i], points[i + 1]))

        for i in range(len(paths)):
            animations.append(MoveAlongPath(obj, paths[i], run_time=run_time, rate_func=rate_func))

        return animations

    def lithium_grid(self, rows, cols) -> Mobject:
        list = []
        for i in range(rows):
            for j in range(cols):
                list.append(self.lithium_ion().set_x(j).set_y(i))
        return VGroup(*list).set_x(0).set_y(0)

    def carbon_layer(self) -> Mobject:
        list = []
        positions = [
            [-1.2, 0, 0],
            [-0.45, 0.4, 0],
            [0.45, 0.4, 0],
            [1.2, 0, 0],
            [0.55, -0.3, 0],
            [-0.55, -0.3, 0],
        ]
        small = [2, 1, 1, 2, 0, 0]
        for i in range(len(positions)):
            list.append(Line(positions[i], positions[(i + 1) % len(positions)], color=GREY_B).set_z_index(4))
            list.append(self.carbon(small[i]).set_x(positions[i][0]).set_y(positions[i][1]))
        list.append(Polygon(*positions, color=WHITE).set_fill(WHITE, 0.075).set_z_index(-1))
        return VGroup(*list)

    def lithium_ion(self) -> Mobject:
        return self.circle_with_text(0.285, "Li$^+$", RED_D, 25, WHITE, 1)

    def oxygen(self) -> Mobject:
        list = []
        start = 0.3
        end = 0.6
        list.append(Line(start=LEFT * start, end=LEFT * end))
        list.append(Line(start=RIGHT * start, end=RIGHT * end))
        list.append(Line(start=UP * start, end=UP * end))
        list.append(Line(start=DOWN * start, end=DOWN * end))
        list = map(lambda x: x.set_opacity(0.7), list)
        return VGroup(self.circle_with_text(0.285, "O$^2$", GREY_B, 25, WHITE, 1), *list)

    def metal(self) -> Mobject:
        return self.circle_with_text(0.285, "Co", BLUE_D, 25, WHITE, 1)

    def circle_with_text(
        self, r: int, txt: str, color=BLACK, font_size: int = 10, font_color=BLACK, stroke_width: int = 2, fill_color=BLACK
    ) -> Mobject:
        c = Circle(r, color).set_opacity(1).set_fill(fill_color)
        t = Tex(txt, stroke_width=stroke_width, font_size=font_size, color=font_color)
        return VGroup(c, t)

    def carbon(self, small: int = False) -> Mobject:
        return self.circle_with_text(
            0.285 if small == 0 else (0.225 if small == 1 else 0.25),
            "C",
            GRAY_B,
            30 if small == 0 else (24 if small == 1 else 27),
            WHITE,
            1,
        ).set_z_index(5 if small == 1 else 10) </s>

BACKGROUND_COLOR = "#ffffff"
BAR_COLOR = "#3e7aab"
LABEL_COLOR = "#333333"

class FractionBarGraph(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        self.camera.background_color = BACKGROUND_COLOR

        # Create a list to hold the bars and labels.
        bars = []
        labels = []

        # Define the maximum height of the bars and the total number of bars.
        max_height = 5
        num_bars = 6

        # Create bars and corresponding labels.
        for i in range(1, num_bars + 1):
            height = max_height * (i / num_bars)
            bar = Rectangle(width=0.8, height=height, color=BAR_COLOR, fill_opacity=1)
            label = MathTex(f"\\frac{{{i}}}{{{num_bars}}}", color=LABEL_COLOR)
            bars.append(bar)
            labels.append(label)

        # Position the bars and labels.
        bar_group = VGroup(*bars)
        label_group = VGroup(*labels)
        bar_group.arrange(RIGHT, buff=1)
        label_group.arrange(RIGHT, buff=1)

        # Align the bars to the bottom and position the labels right below the bars.
        for i in range(num_bars):
            bars[i].align_to(bar_group, DOWN)
            labels[i].next_to(bars[i], DOWN)

        # Group the bars and the labels together.
        graph_group = VGroup(bar_group, label_group)
        graph_group.move_to(ORIGIN)

        for bar, label in zip(bars, labels):
            # Animate each bar and its corresponding label.
            self.play(
                GrowFromEdge(bar, DOWN),
                Write(label),
                run_time=0.5
            )

        # Show the entire graph for a brief moment
        self.wait(1)

        # Animate moving and scaling down of all the bars except the third one
        self.play(
            *[bar.animate.scale(0) for bar in bars if bar != bars[2]],
            *[FadeOut(label) for label in labels if label != labels[2]],
            run_time=0.8
        )

        # Highlight the selected bar and label
        self.play(
            bars[2].animate.set_color(YELLOW),
            labels[2].animate.set_color(YELLOW),
            run_time=0.5
        )

        # Animate shifting out all graph elements to the left
        self.play(
            *[FadeOut(mob) for mob in self.mobjects],
            run_time=0.5
        )

        # Clear the scene
        self.clear() </s>

class AreaUnderCurve(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_1^3 x^2 \,dx")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for setting up the integral
        explanation1 = Text("Calculate the area under the curve from x=1 to x=3", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Performing the integration
        integration_step = MathTex(r"= \left[\frac{1}{3} x^3\right]_1^3")

        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for evaluating the integral
        explanation2 = Text("Plugging in the upper and lower bounds", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Final solution
        final_solution = MathTex(r"= \frac{1}{3}(3)^3 - \frac{1}{3}(1)^3", r"= 9 - \frac{1}{3}", r"= \frac{26}{3}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(integration_step, final_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Clear the scene and conclude
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)
        self.play(Write(final_solution))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class MoleculeScene(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Adding hydrogen molecule
        molecule = self.create_molecule()
        self.play(FadeIn(molecule))
        self.wait()

        # Moving molecule in a zigzag path
        points = [UP * 2, UP * 2 + RIGHT * 4, DOWN * 2, DOWN * 2 + LEFT * 4]
        path_animations = move_along_complex_path(molecule, [1, 2], points, run_time=4)

    def create_molecule(self):
        # Create atoms
        hydrogen_1 = circle_with_text(0.3, 'H', WHITE, 24, BLACK, 1, RED_A).shift(LEFT)
        hydrogen_2 = circle_with_text(0.3, 'H', WHITE, 24, BLACK, 1, BLUE_A).shift(RIGHT)

        # Create bond
        bond = Line(hydrogen_1.get_center(), hydrogen_2.get_center(), color=GREY_B)

        # Create molecule out of atoms and bond
        molecule = VGroup(hydrogen_1, hydrogen_2, bond)
        return molecule

class FibonacciSpiral(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        colors = it.cycle([RED, BLUE, GREEN, YELLOW, PURPLE])

        # Create a list to hold Fibonacci numbers and add the first two
        fib_numbers = [0, 1]
        for _ in range(5):
            fib_numbers.append(fib_numbers[-1] + fib_numbers[-2])

        squares = VGroup()
        for index, value in enumerate(fib_numbers[2:]):
            # Create a square with side length corresponding to a Fibonacci number
            square = Square(side_length=value)
            square.set_stroke(width=2)
            square.set_fill(next(colors), opacity=0.5)

            # Position the square based on index
            if index % 4 == 0:
                square.next_to(squares, UP, buff=0)
            elif index % 4 == 1:
                square.next_to(squares, RIGHT, buff=0)
            elif index % 4 == 2:
                square.next_to(squares, DOWN, buff=0)
            elif index % 4 == 3:
                square.next_to(squares, LEFT, buff=0)

            squares.add(square)

        # Draw the Fibonacci spiral using quarter-circles inside the squares
        spiral = VMobject()
        for i, square in enumerate(squares):
            angle_start = i * PI / 2  # Start angle of each quarter-circle
            arc = Arc(radius=square.side_length / 2,
                      start_angle=angle_start,
                      angle=PI/2)
            arc.move_arc_center_to(square.get_corner(UP + RIGHT) +
                                   RotateVector(square.side_length/2 * DOWN, angle_start))
            spiral.add(arc)

        spiral.set_color_by_gradient(BLUE, GREEN)

        # Group squares and spiral for easier handling
        fib_spiral = VGroup(squares, spiral)

        # Animate
        self.play(LaggedStart(*[DrawBorderThenFill(sq) for sq in squares], lag_ratio=0.5))
        self.play(ShowCreation(spiral), run_time=4)
        self.wait(2)

        # Center the whole group of squares and spiral on the screen
        self.play(fib_spiral.animate.to_edge(UP, buff=1))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class DoubleIntegralPolarExample(Scene):
    def construct(self):

def circle_with_text(
    r: int, txt: str, color=BLACK, font_size: int = 10, font_color=BLACK, stroke_width: int = 2, fill_color=BLACK
) -> Mobject:
    c = Circle(r, color).set_opacity(1).set_fill(fill_color)
    t = Tex(txt, stroke_width=stroke_width, font_size=font_size, color=font_color)
    return VGroup(c, t)

class FourierSeriesScene(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        self.camera.background_color = "#dee3e6"
        path = Circle().scale(2)
        fourier_series = self.get_fourier_series(path, color=PURE_RED, n_terms=10)
        
        self.play(ShowCreation(path), run_time=2)
        self.wait()
        
        for n, partial_sum in enumerate(fourier_series):
            self.play(TransformFromCopy(path, partial_sum), run_time=2)
            self.wait(0.5)

    def get_fourier_series(self, path, color=RED, n_terms=10):
        fourier_series = []
        for n in range(1, n_terms + 1):
            sine_wave = self.get_sine_wave(n, path, color)
            sine_wave.scale(0.5)
            fourier_series.append(sine_wave)
        return fourier_series

    def get_sine_wave(self, frequency, path, color):
        def func(t):
            return np.array([np.sin(frequency * t), np.cos(frequency * t), 0])
        sine_wave = ParametricFunction(func, t_range=[0, TAU], color=color)
        sine_wave.move_to(path.get_center())
        return sine_wave

class FourierSeriesOfSquareWave(FourierSeriesScene):
    def get_sine_wave(self, frequency, path, color):
        if frequency % 2 == 0:
            return VMobject()  # Even harmonics are not present in square wave.
        amplitude = 4 / (np.pi * frequency)  # Amplitude of the sine wave
        def square_wave_func(t):
            return np.array([amplitude * np.sin(frequency * t), 2 * (t - PI / 2) / TAU, 0])
        sine_wave = ParametricFunction(square_wave_func, t_range=[0, TAU], color=color)
        sine_wave.move_to(path.get_center())
        return sine_wave

    def construct(self):
        self.camera.background_color = "#dee3e6"
        path = Square().scale(2)
        fourier_series = self.get_fourier_series(path, n_terms=10)

        self.play(ShowCreation(path), run_time=2)
        self.wait()

        for n, partial_sum in enumerate(fourier_series):
            self.play(TransformFromCopy(path, partial_sum), run_time=2)
            self.wait(0.5) </s>

class EpitrochoidScene(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        R = 3    # Radius of the larger circle
        r = 1    # Radius of the smaller circle
        d = 2    # Distance from the center of the smaller circle

        def epitrochoid(t):
            x = (R + r) * np.cos(t) - d * np.cos((R + r) / r * t)
            y = (R + r) * np.sin(t) - d * np.sin((R + r) / r * t)
            return np.array([x, y, 0])

        path = ParametricFunction(epitrochoid, t_range=[0, TAU * r], color=BLUE)

        dot = Dot(color=BLUE).move_to(path.get_start())
        self.add(dot, path)
        self.play(MoveAlongPath(dot, path), run_time=8, rate_func=linear)
        self.wait(1) </s>

class TorusSurface(ThreeDScene):
    def construct(self):
        resolution_fa = 22
        self.set_camera_orientation(phi=45 * DEGREES, theta=45 * DEGREES)

        def param_surface(u, v):
            R = 1
            r = 0.25
            return np.array([
                (R + r * np.cos(v)) * np.cos(u),
                (R + r * np.cos(v)) * np.sin(u),
                r * np.sin(v)
            ])

        surface = ParametricSurface(
            param_surface,
            u_range=[0, TAU],
            v_range=[0, TAU],
            resolution=(resolution_fa, resolution_fa)
        )
        surface.set_style(fill_opacity=0.5, stroke_color=BLUE)
        
        self.play(Create(surface), run_time=3)
        self.begin_ambient_camera_rotation(rate=0.3)
        self.wait(10) </s>

class TripleIntegralExample(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\int_{0}^{1} \int_{0}^{1} \int_{0}^{1} xyz \,dz\,dy\,dx")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for inner integral
        explanation1 = Text("First, integrate with respect to z", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Inner integral step
        inner_integral = MathTex(r"= \int_{0}^{1} \int_{0}^{1} [\frac{1}{2}xyz^2]_{0}^{1} \,dy\,dx")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), inner_integral))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for middle integral
        explanation2 = Text("Next, integrate with respect to y", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Middle integral step
        middle_integral = MathTex(r"= \int_{0}^{1} [\frac{1}{4}xy^2]_{0}^{1} \,dx")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(inner_integral, middle_integral))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explanation for outer integral
        explanation3 = Text("Finally, integrate with respect to x", font_size=24).to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation3))
        self.wait(2)

        # Outer integral step and final solution
        final_solution = MathTex(r"= [\frac{1}{8}x^2]_{0}^{1}", r"= \frac{1}{8}")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(middle_integral, final_solution))
        self.wait(1)

        # Clear the scene and conclude
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)
        self.play(Write(final_solution))
        self.wait(1) </s>

class SurfaceAreaParametricSurface(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        # Displaying the surface integral problem
        problem = MathTex(r"\iint_S \, dS")
        self.play(Write(problem))
        self.wait(1)

        # Displaying the parametric surface equation
        surface_eq = MathTex(r"S(u,v) = f(u,v)\hat{i} + g(u,v)\hat{j} + h(u,v)\hat{k}")
        surface_eq.next_to(problem, DOWN)
        self.play(Write(surface_eq))
        self.wait(2)

        # Explaining the formula for surface area element in parametric form
        explanation1 = Text("For a surface parametrized by u and v", font_size=24)
        explanation1.to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Write(explanation1))
        self.wait(2)

        # Surface area element formula
        dS_formula = MathTex(r"dS = \left| \frac{\partial S}{\partial u} \times \frac{\partial S}{\partial v} \right| dudv")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(surface_eq.copy(), dS_formula))
        self.wait(2)

        # Displaying the integral with the surface area element
        integral_with_dS = MathTex(r"\iint_S \left| \frac{\partial S}{\partial u} \times \frac{\partial S}{\partial v} \right| dudv")
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(problem.copy(), integral_with_dS))
        self.wait(1)

        # Explaining how to solve the integral
        explanation2 = Text("Solve the below double integral to find the surface area", font_size=24)
        explanation2.to_edge(UP)
        self.play(Transform(explanation1, explanation2))
        self.wait(2)

        # Final solution placeholder (not solved)
        final_solution = Text("Surface area = ...", font_size=24)
        final_solution.to_edge(UP)
        self.play(ReplacementTransform(explanation1, final_solution))
        self.wait(2)

        # Finish the scene
        self.play(FadeOut(final_solution), FadeOut(integral_with_dS))
        self.wait(1) </s>

from manim import *


class ComplexPlaneWithFunctionDots(ComplexPlane):
    class InputDot(Dot):
        def __init__(self, plane, **kwargs):
            super().__init__(**kwargs)

            self.plane = plane

        def get_value(self):
            return self.plane.p2n(self.get_center())

        def set_value(self, value):
            self.move_to(self.plane.n2p(value))

            return self

    class OutputDot(Dot):
        def __init__(self, plane, input_dot, func, **kwargs):
            super().__init__(**kwargs)

            self.plane = plane
            self.input_dot = input_dot
            self.func = func

            self.update_position()
            always(self.update_position)

        def get_value(self):
            return self.plane.p2n(self.get_center())

        def update_position(self):
            self.move_to(self.plane.n2p(self.func(self.input_dot.get_value())))

    def get_function_dots(self, func, *, input_config={}, output_config={}):
        input_dot = self.InputDot(self, **input_config)
        output_dot = self.OutputDot(self, input_dot, func, **output_config)

        return input_dot, output_dot


class Euler(Scene):
    def construct(self):
        plane = ComplexPlaneWithFunctionDots()
        plane.add_coordinates(*plane.get_default_coordinate_values())
        self.add(plane)

        theta_dot, z_dot = plane.get_function_dots(
            lambda z: np.exp(1j * z),
            input_config={"color": RED},
            output_config={"color": YELLOW, "z_index": 1},
        )

        path = TracedPath(z_dot.get_center, min_distance_to_new_point=0)

        formula = MathTex("z", "=e^{i", r"\theta}").move_to(5.5 * LEFT + 2.5 * UP)
        formula[0].set_color(z_dot.get_color())
        formula[2].set_color(theta_dot.get_color())

        formula_box = Rectangle(
            width=formula.get_width() + MED_SMALL_BUFF,
            height=formula.get_height() + MED_SMALL_BUFF,
        )
        formula_box.move_to(formula).set_fill(BLACK, opacity=1).set_stroke(
            BLUE, opacity=1, width=DEFAULT_STROKE_WIDTH / 2
        )

        formula_group = VGroup(formula_box, formula)

        self.add(path, formula_group, theta_dot, z_dot)
        self.play(theta_dot.set_value, TAU, run_time=3)

        indicate_path = Circle(color=PINK)
        self.play(ShowCreationThenDestruction(indicate_path), run_time=3)

        self.play(theta_dot.set_value, 1j, run_time=3)
        self.play(Rotating(theta_dot, about_point=ORIGIN), run_time=3)
        self.play(theta_dot.move_to, plane.n2p(0)) </s>

    def construct(self):
        # Let's create a simple neural network with 3 layers
        
        # Define the number of neurons for each layer

        middle_layer_color = GREEN
        output_layer_color = RED

        # Initial positions
        first_layer_position = LEFT * 3
        middle_layer_position = ORIGIN
        output_layer_position = RIGHT * 3

            *[Circle(radius=0.2, color=first_layer_color) for _ in range(layers[0])]

            *[Circle(radius=0.2, color=middle_layer_color) for _ in range(layers[1])]
        ).arrange(DOWN, buff=0.5).move_to(middle_layer_position)

        # Create the output layer
        output_layer = VGroup(
            *[Circle(radius=0.2, color=output_layer_color) for _ in range(layers[2])]
        ).arrange(DOWN, buff=0.5).move_to(output_layer_position)

        # Draw the neurons in the scene
        self.add(first_layer, middle_layer, output_layer)

        # Function for creating arrows from one layer to another
        def connect_layers(layer1, layer2):
            return VGroup(
                *[Line(layer1[i].get_center(), layer2[j].get_center(), buff=0.1)
                  for i in range(len(layer1)) for j in range(len(layer2))]
            )
        
        # Connect the first layer to the middle layer
        first_to_middle_arrows = connect_layers(first_layer, middle_layer)
        # Connect the middle layer to the output layer
        middle_to_output_arrows = connect_layers(middle_layer, output_layer)

        # Add the arrows to the scene
        self.add(first_to_middle_arrows, middle_to_output_arrows)

        # Move the camera to get a better view
        self.move_camera(phi=75 * DEGREES, theta=30 * DEGREES)

        # Show passing flash to simulate signal
        self.play(ShowPassingFlash(first_to_middle_arrows.copy().set_color(YELLOW), run_time=2, lag_ratio=0.2))
        self.play(ShowPassingFlash(middle_to_output_arrows.copy().set_color(YELLOW), run_time=2, lag_ratio=0.2))

        # Hold on the last frame
        self.wait() </s>

        # Clear the scene and display only the solution
        self.clear()
        self.wait(1)
